Uses of LSPQuery in edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend
 

Methods in edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.backend with parameters of type LSPQuery
 LSPResults QueryProcessor.query(LSPQuery query)
          This default implementation clones the LSPQuery, calls setActualFilter() on the clone, then setActualRanking() on the clone, then calls validateQuery()queryImpl() method.
protected abstract  void QueryProcessor.setActualFilter(LSPQuery query)
          An implementation of this method should look at the LSPFilter inside the LSPQuery and, if necessary, change it.
protected abstract  void QueryProcessor.setActualRanking(LSPQuery query)
          An implementation of this method should look at the LSPFilter inside the LSPQuery and, if necessary, change it.
protected abstract  LSPResults QueryProcessor.queryImpl(LSPQuery query)
          The abstract method where the query processing actually takes place.
protected abstract  void QueryProcessor.validateQuery(LSPQuery query)
          An implementor of this method should throw an exception if the query is not valid, otherwise do nothing.
 LSPResults BackEndLSP.query(LSPQuery query)
          Perform a query operation onto the underlying subcollection.
protected  void StandardQueryProcessor.setActualFilter(LSPQuery query)
          Change the query's filter, if necessary, to eliminate all illegal field/modifier combinations.
protected  void StandardQueryProcessor.setActualRanking(LSPQuery query)
          Change the query's ranking, if necessary, to eliminate all illegal field/modifier combinations.
protected  void StandardQueryProcessor.validateQuery(LSPQuery query)
          Will throw an exception if any of the following is true: The queryPartsSupported property of LSPMetaAttributes does not contain an "F", but the query contains a filter The queryPartsSupported property of LSPMetaAttributes does not contain an "R", but the query contains a ranking The query has neither a filter nor a ranking
